intro: Campylocentrum brevifolium, commonly known as the dwarf broadleaf hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, broad leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
